summary:
Tenacious and focused  business director who has played a leading role in building biopharm businesses, developing and capitalizing on an extensive personal network within the industry. Has created powerful company images and product positioning enabling businesses to thrive, in both an employed and a consultative capacity. 
Founded the ISPE Global Disposables community of practice and was chair for the first 3 years. Regular presenter at International conferences and widely published in industry journals such as Biopharm & Bioprocess International notably co-authoring a regular column on disposable technologies from 2008 - 2011. Senior Visiting lecturer at MBI continuous education biomanufacturing training courses, University College London. 

Key attributes: Commercially aware, able to balance risk, cost and commercial goals; Able to influence through building and maintaining strong professional relationships; Comfortable working under pressure and able to prioritise. 

Specialities: Business Development, Marketing, PR, Manufacturing and Process Consulting, single-use technologies for biomanufacturing

currentPositions.description: Responsible for building a consistent and comprehensive market image for the Sartorius Bioprocess Solutions organization through all marketing channels and customer interactions, representing Sartorius with key external stakeholders. Drive and further enhance market perception and positioning  of Sartorius.​
currentPositions.title: Head of Market Communication strategy & Customer Advocacy

headline: Head of Market Communication Stategy & Customer Advocacy, Sartorius Bioprocess Solutions division  developing sustainable growth strategies for single-use bioprocessing

organizations.name: International Society for Pharmaceutical engineering (ISPE)
organizations.description: Founded this community of practice at the ISPE aimed at promoting education to industry on implementation of disposable technologies for biomanufacturing and working towards developing guidelines for industry concerning manufacturing, quality and supply chain standards. I continue to be a member of this committee
organizations.position: Chair global disposable technologies community of practice

organizations.name: Sartorius Stedim Biotech
organizations.position: Chair Sartorius Industry Associations and Standards Community of Practice

organizations.name: BPOG
organizations.description: Oversight of Sartorius activities within the different BPOG working groups, technology strategy, cell & gene therapy , supplier partner, critical raw materials, Sustainabilityhe

publications.name: Title: a Sustainable, single-use facility for monoclonal antibody production
publications.publisher: Publication: Bioprocess International, Vol11, No 11, pp 34-40

publications.name: Monoclonal Antibody Manufacturing: Cost Benefits of Hybrid Disposable Systems
publications.publisher: BioProcess International, Vol. 9, No. 9, October 2011, pp. 12–17

publications.name: :  An Economic Comparison of Three Cell Culture Techniques
publications.publisher: :  Biopharm International, Vol. 24, No. 2, May 2011, pp. 54–60

publications.name: End to End deployment of single-use technology in aseptic filling of vaccines at GSK
The Role of Disposables in Rapid Response Manufacturing

publications.description: An environmental study of single-use process technology offers an examination of environmental impacts across the full process train using lifecycle assessment.
publications.name: An Environmental Lifecycle Assessment of Single-Use and Conventional Process Technology: Comprehensive Environmental Impacts
Implementing Flexible, Scalable & Cost-effective platforms
publications.description: This articles desribes the Sartorius Integrated solutions approach to ensure successful build and implementation of a multi-product CMO facility base on Single-use technologies. The article demonstrates through a case study with Wuxi Apptec how the Sartorius Integrated solutions approach to bioprocess design and engineering of such facilities ensures a proven timeline reduction whilst ensuring a successful implementation of single-use technologies demonstrating both a sustainable and cost-effective facility which has won honorable mentions for the ISPE facility of the year in 2014

Outsourcing can be an effective way to access in-depth bioprocessing expertise, but leaning on external resources can restrict internal learning. This article explores if there is a way to get the best of both worlds.
publications.name: Bioprocess Knowledge is power

publications.description: This conference report refers to the keynote presentations from Alison Moore (senior vice president of process development at Amgen) and Janet Woodcock (director of the Center for Drug Evaluation and Research, CDER, at the US Food and Drug Administration) at ECI’s Integrated Continuous Biomanufacturing Conference II in Berkeley, CA, in late 2015.
publications.name: Deciding on an Integrated Continuous Processing Approach: A conference Report

publications.description: This article examines key advances in single-use process platforms that are simplifying the implementation of biomanufacturing processes still further and are delivering significant benefits to drug developers by allowing them to decrease the time taken for products to reach the market, increase product safety and decrease manufacturing costs.
publications.name: Single-Use Platforms Helping Democratize Biomanufacturing

publications.description:
The pipeline of biopharmaceutical drugs is rich and becoming increasingly diverse. Many new biologic modalities are being developed as established therapeutic classes move through their lifecycle. Wide arrays of different types of molecules are expected to coexist within product portfolios and manufacturing networks. This article discusses strategies that need to be developed to prepare
facilities for these challenges.
publications.name: Accelerating Biopharmaceutical Development from DNA to Drug

publications.description: Intensified bioprocessing techniques are allowing biologics manufacturers to achieve higher productivities from smaller production footprints in less time than before. In the near term, companies can make process improvements guided by process-cost–modeling tools to intensify their production trains. The article details how SSB can provide a range of innovations for intensified upstream and downstream processing and support manufacturers with both novel high-throughput development tools and a suite of data analytics software.
publications.name: Implementing  Process Intensification in Commercial Manufacturing

publications.description: Challenges remain for biopharmaceutical companies bringing products to market. Product sponsors must manage uncertainty while accelerating biologics into the clinic and then onto market. Bioprocesses must meet stringent quality requirements with efficiency to provide the lowest possible overall costs. Miriam Monge writes about how Sartorius Stedim Biotech is helping clients address those challenges through end-to-end single-use production platforms.
publications.name: Single-Use Production Platforms for Biomanufacturing
publications.publisher: BioProcess International, Sartorius Stedim Biotech Special Report

publications.name: Viral Vector Development, Manufacturing, and Process Intensification
Single-use Process Platforms Help Biomanufacturers Reduce costs
publications.description: The article talks about how manufacturers can be successful in the implementation of single-use process platforms, supported by their selected partner. By adopting predefined process platforms the engineering burden is considerably reduced, lowering the cost and speed of implementation even in the event that the platform must be adapted to their specific requirements and will subsequently enable firms to reach the clinic sooner.

publications.name: Single-Use equipment in biopharmaceutical manufacture
publications.description: Co-author of 2 chapters of this publication in Wiley
Together with Priyanka Gupta led a Series of expert interviews of Sartorius clients and collaboration partners moving rapidly to implement Process intensification
publications.name: Process intensification and expert insights

publications.description: A long-time editorial advisor for BPI, Miriam Monge is head of marketing for fluid-management technologies (FMT) at Sartorius, where she works to develop sustainable growth strategies for single-use bioprocessing. Over the past 20 years, she has played a significant role in championing development, promotion, analysis, and adoption of single-use technologies (SUTs). We asked her to share her experiences and to offer additional thoughts about current and future industry trends.
publications.name: Intensifying Bioprocessing: Profiling 20 Years of Advances Driven By Single-Use Technologies

publications.description:
In this paper the authors describe how Sartorius supports biomanufacturing industry players in reraching their sustainability goals without compromosing their delivery of patient care solutions. We also discuss teh significance of choosing technologies & manufacturing processes to boost environmental sustainability. Key takeaways of this white paper:

Climate Action: Discover how efficient manufacturing strategies can    impact the climate.

Water-Use Efficiency: Understand how  facilities working with SU technologies can significantly reduce water consumption.

Material & Circularity: Learn the importance of understanding a products' environmental footprint and how we can foster circularity.

Partnerships:  Get an insight into the industry groups and partners  we are collaborating with to enact meaningful changes in the industry and beyond.
publications.name: Driving environmental sustainability within the biopharmaceutical industry

publications.description:
In order to enhance access to life-saving medicines, the biopharmaceutical industry must prioritize more efficient therapeutic production. However, the environmental impact of manufacturing choices is facing increasing scrutiny. Sustainability opportunities within the biopharmaceutical sector encompass reducing the environmental footprint, addressing resource depletion, and effectively managing waste through repurposing and recycling.

During a recent panel discussion, sustainability experts from Sartorius and their collaborators shared valuable insights on enhancing the sustainability of manufacturing processes. These insights encompass adopting single-use technologies, improving process efficiency, and fostering productive collaborations. This Special Report offers extracts from those enlightening discussions, along with relevant excerpts from Sartorius’ white paper on sustainability in the biopharmaceutical industry.
publications.name: Driving environmental sustainability within the biopharmaceutical industry, a special report in BPI

publications.description: eBook in partnership with BPI, "Intensified Bioprocesses: Uniting Productivity and Sustainability", authored by Brian Gazaille and based on the BPI Amsterdam Keynote by Miriam Monge. Learn about the different process & technology scenarios to consider ensuring the most favorable environmental impact for your manufacturing facility. Discover how process intensification technologies such as BioSMB MCC enable users to decrease downstream buffer and resin use by 30% and 70%, respectively, while accelerating processing times. Water use represents a major environmental contributor; reducing buffer requirements helps to increase process sustainability.
publications.name: "Intensified Bioprocesses: Uniting Productivity and Sustainability",  an interview with Miriam Monge

message.text:
Day 2  at France Bioproduction - the #Sartorius team have been extremely busy on the our  stand number 37/38  with a truly packed conference! Not too late to visit our stand to learn about all our latest innovations both Upstream and Downstream , meet with Lídia Garcia Coronado,  @Frédérique Thibaut, Jayson DUVAL,  David RETOUR, Beatrice Claverie, FREDERIQUE MARME-GALLOO, Barbara Coloma, learn about Ambr 15, Streamlink CC15,
4 Cell CHO, Sartocheck, AseptiQuik connections,  Celsius FFT, & all about our re-imagine Chromatography exciting portfolio

Gave a joint presentation this afternoon at  #CFB24  together with Simon Massot, Sanofi presenting the results of our collaboration between Sanofi, Sartorius, & Veolia '  Innovative Solutions for an Agile and Sustainable facility: Mechanical recyling of Post-Use bioprocessing Plastic Containers - mechanical recyling technical feasibility' The presentation was welll received with multiple questions during the roundtable. Several participants asked how they could get more involved in this recycling programme - please do reach out  to: sustainabilityforum@sartorius.com to connect & get involved.  One of the questions we received was around the need for greater collaboration across the industry  - it was agreed that in this domaine we all need to actively collaborate to achieve tangible results as quickly as possible. The next phase of our Sanofi, sartorius, Veolia collabroation needs to scale up to industrial phase of recycling, we are looking for partners to achieve this. Please reach out!

Workshop at bio production France ‘challenges & benefits of implementing intensified and continuous upstream processing strategies led by  David Balbuena  at LFB biomanufacturing, Gabriel Fisicaro innovation development LFB Max-Olivier Broquet Manager of field application specialists at Sartorius and Gilles Valarcher from Repligen great exchange of experience with an increasing number of companies actively testing& implementing  PI technologies at all scales , not surprising when one evaluates the huge productivity , process time reduction, flexibility increase , clean room footprint reduction with the #environmentalsustainability benefits brought by   
#Processintensification

Opening of 8th France Bioproduction by President of Servier M. Olivier Laureau . Highlighted that France has moved from 3rd  position to 2nd position in Europe in terms of the number of biologics in development . Roland Lescure French minister  of industry highlighted over 300 Million€ state contribution to over 80 innovative projects in the biologics field . Highlighted the importance of both supporting start ups but also relocalising  biologics production to France . By 2030 50% of medicines  will be provided through biologics devpt & manufacturing  . Excited to be taking part in these 2 days of active networking
Do check out our fabulous portfolio & services in the #CellandGeneTherapy space!

Ready to set the standard in cell and gene therapy with Sartorius? See how we’re helping to make the impossible possible. Get started: https://sar.to/37fgm

#SimplifyingProgress #InThisTogether #AdvancedTherapies #CellandGeneTherapy

Ravie de présenter avec Sanofi la semaine prochaine au congrès France Bioproduction, Paris  les résultats de notre collaboration 
I am delighted to be presenting the results of our collaboration with Sanofi next week at Bioproduction France, Paris  

Conférence #8 : "𝗦𝗼𝗹𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝗶𝗻𝗻𝗼𝘃𝗮𝗻𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗽𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘂𝗻𝗲 𝗶𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗹𝗲 𝗲𝘁 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 : 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝘆𝗰𝗹𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗺𝗲́𝗰𝗮𝗻𝗶𝗾𝘂𝗲 𝗱𝗲𝘀 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝗮𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗲𝗻 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗾𝘂𝗲 𝗱𝗲 𝗯𝗶𝗼𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲́𝗱𝗲́𝘀 𝗽𝗼𝘀𝘁-𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘀𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 - 𝗙𝗮𝗶𝘀𝗮𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝗲́ 𝘁𝗲𝗰𝗵𝗻𝗶𝗾𝘂𝗲 𝗱𝘂 𝗿𝗲𝗰𝘆𝗰𝗹𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗺𝗲́𝗰𝗮𝗻𝗶𝗾𝘂𝗲" présentée par Miriam Monge, Responsable de la Stratégie et de l'Advocacy Client, Sartorius, et Simon Massot de Sanofi

Innovative Solutions for an Agile & Sustainable Facility
Recycling of Single-use Technologies, 
We will present the outcome of a collaboration between #Sanofi, #Sartorius and #Veolia evaluating the technical feasibility of recycling of single-use technologies for biopharmaceutical manufacturing. I hope to see you there! 
#environmentalsustainability #bioprocessing #développementdurable

[#BIOPRODUCTION] 💊 Ne manquez pas la 8ème édition du Congrès France Bioproduction, coorganisée par Medicen Paris Region et POLEPHARMA !

📅 Les 3 & 4 avril 2024 au Palais des Congrès de Massy, Agglomération Paris-Saclay

Découvrez les temps fort de la deuxième session "Bioproduction : Nouveaux Modèles pour un développement durable" 👇

🎙️ Conférence #5 : "𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗿𝗲́𝗱𝘂𝗶𝗿𝗲 𝗹𝗲𝘀 𝗰𝗼𝘂̂𝘁𝘀, 𝗹𝗲𝘀 𝗿𝗶𝘀𝗾𝘂𝗲𝘀 𝗱'𝗮𝗽𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘃𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗲𝘁 𝗹'𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗮𝗰𝘁 𝗲𝗻𝘃𝗶𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗱𝗲 𝘃𝗼𝘁𝗿𝗲 𝗯𝗶𝗼𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 : 𝗖𝗼𝗿𝗲𝗕𝗶𝗼𝗴𝗲𝗻𝗲𝘀𝗶𝘀, 𝘂𝗻𝗲 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗲 𝗶𝗻𝗻𝗼𝘃𝗮𝗻𝘁𝗲 𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗿𝗮-𝗲́𝘃𝗼𝗹𝘂𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗲𝘁 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗽𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗹𝗮 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗱𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘁𝗲́𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀 𝗲𝘁 𝗽𝗲𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗱𝗲𝘀 𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗯𝗶𝗻𝗮𝗻𝘁𝘀" présentée par Quentin VICARD, VP Stratégie & Gestion des Alliances chez Core Biogenesis

🎙️ Conférence #6 : "𝗟𝗮 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗲 𝗱𝗲 𝗦𝗮𝗺𝗮𝗯𝗿𝗶𝘃𝗮 : 𝘂𝗻𝗲 𝗿𝗲́𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗲 𝗮𝘂𝘅 𝗱𝗲́𝗳𝗶𝘀 𝗱𝗲 𝘀𝗮𝗻𝘁𝗲́ 𝗽𝘂𝗯𝗹𝗶𝗾𝘂𝗲 𝗲𝘁 𝗲𝗻𝘃𝗶𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝘂𝘅 𝗱𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗹𝗮 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗱𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗶𝗽𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗳𝘀 𝗱’𝗼𝗿𝗶𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗻𝗮𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗲" présentée par Marina Guillet, CEO de SAMABRIVA

🎙️ Conférence #7 : "𝗟𝗮 𝗻𝗲́𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗲́ 𝗱𝗲 𝗹𝗮 𝗰𝗼𝗹𝗹𝗮𝗯𝗼𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗶𝗻𝗱𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗲 𝘀𝘂𝗿 𝗹𝗮 𝗰𝗿𝗲́𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻, 𝗹𝗮 𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘀𝗽𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗲𝘁 𝗹𝗲 𝗽𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗱𝗲 𝗹𝗮 𝗱𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲́𝗲 𝗲𝗻𝘃𝗶𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗲" présentée par Thibault Renaud, Leader en Durabilité de la Chaîne d'Approvisionnement, Cytiva

🎙️ Conférence #8 : "𝗦𝗼𝗹𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝗶𝗻𝗻𝗼𝘃𝗮𝗻𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗽𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘂𝗻𝗲 𝗶𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗹𝗲 𝗲𝘁 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 : 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝘆𝗰𝗹𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗺𝗲́𝗰𝗮𝗻𝗶𝗾𝘂𝗲 𝗱𝗲𝘀 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝗮𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗲𝗻 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗾𝘂𝗲 𝗱𝗲 𝗯𝗶𝗼𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲́𝗱𝗲́𝘀 𝗽𝗼𝘀𝘁-𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘀𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 - 𝗙𝗮𝗶𝘀𝗮𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝗲́ 𝘁𝗲𝗰𝗵𝗻𝗶𝗾𝘂𝗲 𝗱𝘂 𝗿𝗲𝗰𝘆𝗰𝗹𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗺𝗲́𝗰𝗮𝗻𝗶𝗾𝘂𝗲" présentée par Miriam Monge, Responsable de la Stratégie et de l'Advocacy Client, Sartorius, et Simon MASSET de Sanofi

Découvrez le programme complet et inscrivez-vous dès maintenant 👉 https://bit.ly/4anq9k2

commentary.text: Hitto Kaufmann indeed! Hope to see you at the next one Hitto!
Many Congratulations Maurice Phelan we do share the passion! See you next week!

Weichang, many congratulations on your truly amazing career and achievements. I remember very clearly our first meeting during your Sanofi Genzyme days, what an exciting time that was and how far you have come! I am sure you will continue to be very active -  no doubt driving innovation & industry  advocacy in these new therapeutic fields - I do hope  we find the opportunity to meet up soon. All the very best to you!
Congrats Artem all the best to you, wishing you every success!

Delighted & honored to be working with you Lorraine Borland - you are one of a kind! Your deep industry knowledge, your leadership skills, your ‘get things done’ attitude in a fun atmosphere are what I really enjoy about working with you! Here’s to you ! Congratulations!
